creditline: Gift of Ruth and Bruce Dayton
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: shallow, rounded bowl stands on a neatly cut, beveled foot rim; white slip covers the interior and upper half of the exterior, revealing the slightly coarse, buff-grey body; a deep brown-glaze, with six petal lobes, is applied over the slip creating a striking flower pattern
medium:
Yao-chou ware
Stoneware with white slip and brown glaze
text: White slip covers the interior and part of the exterior of this small bowl disguising the slightly coarse buff- grey body typical of the Yao-chou kilns in Shensi province. A deep brown glaze with six petal lobes is applied over the slip creating a striking flower pattern. This design, made by dipping rather than with a brush, is relatively rare.
title: Bowl
